TopicTitle: [.16] Fix for weak large decouplers plus reduced wobble

Articles.Content:
I did a few calculations and decided the new, large decouplers needed some beefing up.

This is a simple .cfg file edit that increases the strength to what it would be just given the parts volume and diameter and based on the strength of the old, small decoupler as a reference. Even with this tweak, you can still knock off an engine or tank if you don\'t design it properly, but you shouldn\'t need to truss the couplers anymore. As a side benefit, my rockets seem to wobble much less.

These new config\'s are 8 times stronger than the original, which is far less than the 10x mass increase would suggest, but I think it\'s a fair balance.

EnragedPlatypus cleared up where the files go, I forgot to say what folders.

The first file should be decoupler1-2 and the second should be radialDecoupler1-2...

The first file is the large TR-19A stack Decoupler .cfg

The second file is the large TT-38K radial decoupler .cfg

Don\'t mix them up.

Edited August 6, 2012 by CrashnBurn

There are four stock decouplers in the game, but only two need modification.

Edited September 28, 2012 by ashrutoraman

The default strength setting is currently 22, I have seen very high settings in the 1000s, but I don't think anything we're building now would require settings that high. 200 is enough for almost any normal rocket part. I've never had to use anything higher.
